title: WWE WrestleMania 41: 20 Things That Must Happen
summary: WWE's WrestleMania 41 is set to take place in Las Vegas with several major storylines in play. Key questions include John Cena's potential 17th World Championship, The Rock's appearance, and Paul Heyman's loyalty to Roman Reigns. The event will feature significant title changes and major developments for the Judgment Day faction, particularly involving Dominik Mysterio and the Intercontinental Championship.
content:
THE CHAMP IS HERE. AGAIN! Why John Cena must break hearts at WrestleMania 41.

It feels like only yesterday that Cody Rhodes was "finishing the story" and beating Roman Reigns to finally become WWE Champion at WrestleMania 40. One year on, WWE has littered the 'Mania 41 lineup with a few puzzling choices, but most fans will leave the weekend remembering the biggest stories. Some questions need to be answered: Will John Cena become a 17-time World Champ? Will The Rock actually turn up? Is Paul Heyman turning on Roman Reigns?

Other choices facing Triple H include thrashing out who leaves with both major Women's Titles, and whether or not he's all in on Jey Uso's quest to dethrone Gunther. As always, and despite some of the painfully obvious excuses to squeeze as many wrestlers as humanly possible onto the undercard, WrestleMania will be some spectacle.

Fans should prepare themselves for huge title changes, at least a handful of shocks that leave everyone's thumbs blistered from gleefully gushing and/or ranting on social apps, and the usual pomp and circumstance people have come to expect when WWE spares no expense. The pyro budget alone could've kept ECW in business.

Pretty much everyone would've been expecting to see either Bron Breakker or Penta's name stuck in as the winner here, but...nope. 'Dirty' Dominik Mysterio scooping some shock Intercontinental Title glory would be one hell of a way to stick a fork in his stable and send Finn Bálor into meltdown. WWE could always shove the belt back on Bron on the Raw after 'Mania if they so wished.

source.title: WWE WrestleMania 41: 20 Things That Must Happen

content.title: WWE WrestleMania 41: 20 Things That Must Happen
content.content:
THE CHAMP IS HERE. AGAIN! Why John Cena must break hearts at WrestleMania 41.

It feels like only yesterday that Cody Rhodes was "finishing the story" and beating Roman Reigns to finally becomeWWEChampion at WrestleMania 40. One year on, WWE has littered the 'Mania 41 lineup with a few puzzling choices, but most fans will leave the weekend remembering the biggest stories. Some questions need to be answered: Will John Cena become a 17-time World Champ? Will The Rock actually turn up? Is Paul Heyman turning on Roman Reigns?

Other choices facing Triple H include thrashing out who leaves with both major Women's Titles, and whether or not he's all in on Jey Uso's quest to dethrone Gunther. As always, and despite some of the painfully obvious excuses to squeeze as many wrestlers as humanly possible onto the undercard,WrestleMania will be some spectacle.

Fans should prepare themselves for huge title changes, at least a handful of shocks that leave everyone's thumbs blistered from gleefully gushing and/or ranting on social apps, and the usual pomp and circumstance people have come to expect when WWE spares no expense. The pyro budget alone could've keptECWin business.

One thing to note: You absolutely willnotagree with everything here, but a lot of thought has gone into it. It's important to look at what happens after 'Mania 41, not just the Saturday and Sunday nights themselves. Hunter will be eager to avoid typical post-supershow lulls, especially withPPVs/PLEs like Backlash and then SummerSlam looming.

Here's absolutely everything that needs to happen when WWE lands in Las Vegas.

First up, a nifty surprise that leaves Judgment Day in tatters.

Pretty much everyone would've been expecting to see either Bron Breakker or Penta's name stuck in as the winner here, but...nope. 'Dirty' Dominik Mysterio scooping some shockIntercontinental Titleglory would be one hell of a way to stick a fork in his stable and send Finn Bálor into meltdown. WWE could always shove the belt back on Bron on the Raw after 'Mania if they so wished.

Mysterio is a heat-seeking missile though, and it's clear there's been trouble in paradise between Judgment Day members for a while. The faction is a shadow of its former self anyway, so it's definitely time to move everyone on to other things. Creative won't do that without booking some easy matches between fractured friends though - Dominik vs. Finn is one of those.

The beauty of this multi-man scenario is that Breakker can drop the IC belt without being pinned or submitted. That might sound like a bit of a cop out, but there's no need to beat himor Pentain Las Vegas when the in-fighting between JD members is right there staring everyone in the face.

It'd be a lot of fun if 'Dirty' Dom Dom got a short reign with main roster singles gold just to tick Bálor off. Then, if need be, Bron can go spear crazy on everybody post-match (like he has on episodes of Raw recently) and stop Finn from getting his hands on a so-called stablemate who just pinned him. Everyone's a winner, at least longer term.

Lifelong wrestling, video game, music and sports obsessive who has been writing about his passions since childhood. Jamie started writing for WhatCulture in 2013, and has contributed thousands of articles and YouTube videos since then. He cut his teeth penning published pieces for top UK and European wrestling read Fighting Spirit Magazine (FSM), and also has extensive experience working within the wrestling biz as a manager and commentator for promotions like ICW on WWE Network and WCPW/Defiant since 2010. Further, Jamie also hosted the old Ministry Of Slam podcast, and has interviewed everyone from Steve Austin and Shawn Michaels to Bret Hart and Trish Stratus.

content.title: WWE WrestleMania 41: 20 Things That Must Happen

markdown_content:
## The Road to WrestleMania 41

The echoes of Cody Rhodes "finishing the story" and capturing the WWE Championship from Roman Reigns at WrestleMania 40 still resonate. Now, as WrestleMania 41's card takes shape, several intriguing storylines demand attention:

* Will John Cena achieve his historic 17th World Championship?
* Can The Rock's appearance be guaranteed?
* Is Paul Heyman plotting against Roman Reigns?

## Championship Landscape

Triple H faces crucial decisions regarding:
- The fate of both Women's Championships
- Jey Uso's ambitious pursuit of Gunther's reign

Despite some questionable booking choices on the undercard, WrestleMania promises its trademark spectacle. The production values alone—with a pyrotechnics budget that "could've kept ECW in business"—ensure an unforgettable showcase.

## Potential Surprises

Fans should brace themselves for:
* Major title changes
* Social media-breaking moments
* Traditional WrestleMania grandeur

## Intercontinental Championship Speculation

While many expected Bron Breakker or Penta to emerge victorious, a surprising twist could see "Dirty" Dominik Mysterio capture the Intercontinental Championship—potentially triggering Finn Bálor's breakdown and destabilizing their faction. WWE could always course-correct on the post-WrestleMania Raw if needed.
